metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5545 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - negligible.
metadata.Description:
The main function in plistutil.c in libimobiledevice libplist through 1.12 allows attackers to obtain sensitive information from process memory or cause a denial of service (buffer over-read) via Apple Property List data that is too short.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5545` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libplist++3v5 - 1.12+git+1+e37ca00-0.3
libplist-utils - 1.12+git+1+e37ca00-0.3
libplist3 - 1.12+git+1+e37ca00-0.3
python3-plist - 1.12+git+1+e37ca00-0.3
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> Affected utility is found in the libplist source package rather than in the libimobiledevice source package sbeattie> also, the affected code is just in the plistutil binary, not in the library itself

criterions.comment: libplist package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.12+git+1+e37ca00-0.3').
